intro: Thesium katangense, commonly known as the Katanga thesium, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its succulent, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
